page.title: 09Little Bo Peep
page.content: Mr Unwin does not keep sheep any more. He used to keep Clun forest sheep because they were hardy sheep.So if you bring them back from the Welsh mountains and put them in good grass they will have twins or triplets.He kept sheep for their meat only because meat is worth more than wool.Meat is worth Â£30 per carcase. He does not keep animals any more because he is growing crops instead.He thinks that the wool trade has died because meat is worth more than wool so wool is not so important.He used to keep sheep on a field one year and then grow crops. He used to do this to fertilise the ground. But now there is no need to do this because fertilisers are cheaper today also you don't need a shepherd to look after crops.
